summary: The Oversight of Medicare Billing Code Cost Act aims to increase oversight and transparency regarding Medicare billing codes. It mandates a study by the HHS Inspector General on the processes used by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) for adding, modifying, and removing billing codes. The study will analyze data, trends, and monitoring efforts, and the Inspector General will report to Congress with recommendations. Furthermore, the Secretary of Health and Human Services is required to annually report to Congress and the public on new Medicare billing codes, their volume, and associated expenditures.
